Updated ZeroFrame.coffee needed

1511856741_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGN.body:
> [kite](#comment_4_14tGkWydPLnPCVP5i9T4WSccnyAuLjEBnv): The UI would be the same, and files would still be accessed via Big Files. Saving video data, loading video metadata and the locations of the videos would need to be reworked in a merger sense.  [...]

Can people create their own hubs on ZeroMe, or just the site owners?

> [krixano](#comment_203_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): People can make their own hubs because you're essentially making your own zite when you do so (but allowing KopyKate to read the data of it). However, other people would need to download the hub to see the posts on it, of course. Imo, hubs in ZeroMe aren't that well done. But, that is not to say that a hub system for KopyKate wouldn't be good, because I think that it could if done right.

So you just basically clone a hub..

Reworded question:
Should KopyKate have merger zites? If so, I'll start working on the feature right away.. :)
 
P.s.
Channels functions will still stay the same. You'd have individual user channels inside of the hubs.

> [styromaniac](#comment_291_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): When I click to seed a video, it vanishes off screen. In the seedbox manager, all is fair and good, but I want to check the download progress. [...]

Show me a screenshot on ZeroMe. I haven't encountered this bug yet.. all of my seeded videos appear on my main page.

> [styromaniac](#comment_291_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): When I click to seed a video, it vanishes off screen. In the seedbox manager, all is fair and good, but I want to check the download progress. [...]

This could be the way videos are sorted.

> [herp](#comment_34_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): Another reason is that you could technically be forced to remove any copyrighted content that was on a zite you control. If the data is stored on merger zites then you decentralize control of that data to the users who created those zites. [...]

haha.. nah, I just want a better username. In the past I've generally just created user ID's in a hurry.. or just to get around the limits, as you said.. as was the case with Kopyjane. This will be my final username ;)

> [herp](#comment_34_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): Another reason is that you could technically be forced to remove any copyrighted content that was on a zite you control. If the data is stored on merger zites then you decentralize control of that data to the users who created those zites. [...]

You mean somebody could force you to sign your site?

> [herp](#comment_40_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): Or just turn the old zite into a merger and have the new zite pull the content from it :D

Yes, that's the one. Just use the old zite as an archived-videos merger zite. Do it every XX mb. 
 
IMO, seems less troublesome than having a separate zite for every individual user channel or something. That would probably overload people's ZeroHello homepages.. and make loading videos slow.

> [herp](#comment_47_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): When uploading a video series one ends up using the same image for all of them, which can quickly fill up space in the index. [...]

Good point!

This would probably require creating a new table in the dbschema, but it may as well come as part of the upcoming 0.2.0 package.

**To sum it up:**
0.1.x was the ALPHA stage. A ZeroUp clone was created in order to experiment with big files + a video sharing platform layout.
0.2.x will be the first BETA stage. The code is re-written from scratch, and features smooth routing, faster loading pages. Coffee script files are produced to make development easier, by reverse-engineering the ZeroUp code and logic.
0.3.x (still BETA) will feature bots and python scripts that make stuff easier.. e.g. Video encoding, reporting and deleting disturbing content, paying a share of ZeroNet proxy mining revenues to channel owners, etc. 

1.x.x will be the official stable release, if everything goes according to plan. ZeroNet proxies will aid in marketing KopyKate as a copyright-free and political censorship-free video platform, whose revenue will be used to fund cryptocurrency-based wealth-redistribution schemes (UBI). (Having said that, proxies will not replace ZeroNet.. rather, they will provide it an extra kick, and extend its reach throughout the web.. for as long as they survive!)

> [herp](#comment_53_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): One minor issue is that uploading a video with the same filename as one of your past videos actually overwrites the past one! Might be good to append a unique-id to the file name upon upload to avoid that? :)

I've noticed this too. This seems to have caused a visible CSS glitch in my new site version - in which video information is appended twice into the same DIV, thus causing distortion and overflow in the video list. But I fixed it by adding a random number to the dynamically generated divs.

> [herp](#comment_54_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): Not just that, it actually overrides the metadata in my case and deletes the old video. Aka it copies the new video over the old video and piece file. Seems like actually renaming the file may be necessary, but can one do that in JS?

Yes, this should be easily fixed. Currently, the ZeroUp javascript adds a time-stamp to the filename, only if its really short.

In this version I'll probably add a time-stamp to all uploaded files.

1513126557_19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2.body:
> [krixano](#comment_206_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): You need to firstly make sure the hub is downloaded. Then, wait till ZeroMe and SunHub fully download. Sorry I can't be of more help, I don't know the full situation.

I just clicked on update..
I can see user posts, but I can't join the sun hub. It's asking me to Create Profile.. then says I already exist in the hub
This can be replicated by deleting ZeroMe (while being logged in with your ID) .. downloading it again, then trying to re-join the hub you were previously in. Bug!

> [krixano](#comment_207_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): You shouldn't be rejoining anything. If your user already exists, then you should have just needed to wait for your previous posts to download.

I should also add.. my ZeroNet client froze multiple times (can't visit any sites) while re-downloading ZeroMe. Might have been part of the problem.
Everything's updated. It's asking me to re-create my profile, and I can't join Sun Hub.
Just joined Kaffiehub in the meantime..

> [krixano](#comment_209_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): What exactly did you do? I need to know every single thing that you did and that happened and why you wanted to do in the first place in order to help you. This is a major reason why messing with ZeroMe hubs is bad - especially if you're trying to switch hubs without knowing how to do it. Because if you do something wrong, you could accidentally delete all your previous posts.

I just created this account today, all I've posted so far is Hello ZeroMe... so no panic .. lol
 
I just deleted ZeroMe (not the hubs), in order to download it again and see what happens. During the process of re-downloading, my client froze.. and I had to shut down zeronet and start it up again. I then logged onto ZeroMe, and it asked me to create my profile again. All I did

> [krixano](#comment_211_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Also, I'm not sure why SunHub wasn't letting you create your profile on there.

I already have a profile on there, I just couldn't re-join the hub

> [krixano](#comment_213_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): The reason why I think you just screwed up your ZeroMe profiles is because now you technically have two profiles on two different hubs. I'm not sure on this though. I'm gonna check the ZeroMe file to see for sure.

This is likely to be the case..
 
There needs to be a Loading Database warning message, or at least a way to detatch from hubs.

> [krixano](#comment_215_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Okay, yes, you do have two profiles (as in two different hubs think that your profile is in two different places) and I'm gonna help you fix that, because if you don't, you'll have a problem with following people (I had this problem also). I need to know which hub you want to be in, KaffieHub or SunHub?

Subhub i guess

I can see that I'm **following** two clones of my profile..
Yes, update/rebuild is complete.

> [krixano](#comment_217_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Did you do the database rebuild?

yes

> [krixano](#comment_218_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Okay, so now, goto ZeroHello, click the three dots, and click "Show data directory". Next, go to the 12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv directory. Then, go to data/users, and go to 19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2YhbyB. This is your user directory where your posts on KaffieHub are stored. [...]

done.

> [krixano](#comment_219_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Next, go here and drag the circular button in the top right to the left. Scroll all the way down, and click on the button next to This is my site. Then, go to the textbox under content publishing and delete everything and type in this: data/users/19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2YhbyB/content.json and click Sign. Then click Publish. [...]

done.

It's just to do with the amount of peers. The star trek video is relatively old, while the Kopykate video I posted today. 
 
What I've noticed is that, it tends to often crap out if there's not enough peers .. thus producing the MIME type error

With the CORS plugin though, you don't need to have kopykate downloaded because the plugin will automatically download it.

yes you would, by the looks of it. You'd have to navigate to the direct link of the file.. then confirm that you want to download the zite.
 
One could easily write a script that would automatically do that for you, though.

> [krixano](#comment_234_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): You can't just use the CORS plugin by having it installed, the zite needs to call a command for it. It's right in the docs.

My mistakes.

It would be great to see corspermission in action, or have an example code snipplet. I must admit, I haven't explored many of the other ZeroNet features beyond bigfiles. It takes a lot of time to figure stuff out!

> [krixano](#comment_235_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): It's fine. Now that I know that you can do this - I'm gonna allow putting KopyKate and ZeroUp videos in ZeroMedium, I think that'll be much better than people uploading videos in multiple places. [...]

but then, if you're gonna turn ZeroMedium into a video sharing platform - wouldn't that defeat the purpose of having KopyKate and zeroup to begin with? I'm all for focusing on a single project, having said that.

> [krixano](#comment_236_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): I'm not turning ZeroMedium into a video sharing platform at all. It's still a place to write stuff, but it's useful to be able to link to videos that are related to your writing. Same with audio, images, and other files. In fact, Medium.com has this feature as well. People who don't want to write about a video won't use ZeroMedium, they'd use KopyKate. [...]

I see what you mean. Just gotta know what I'm doing right now, and where my time is best spent! ;)
